alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 10:42AM CDT until June 04 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. .River levels are slowly falling back. Chances for showers and thunderstorms over the next few days will likely only cause localized impacts. Unless there is a direct storm over the parts of the rivers already in flood stage, the gradual decrease in levels should continue. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Montevideo. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Low lying areas and some roads along the river begin flooding, along with some basements of houses along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM CDT Saturday, the stage was 15.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1000 AM CDT Saturday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon and continue falling to 13.7 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.2 feet on 05/07/1994. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine
